lead_paragraph: GOLDWEBER--Max, 96, died peacefully on February 24th. Family, community, and the law were his lifelong passions. Born and raised in the Bronx, Max was the second youngest of eight children. He was a devoted husband, father and grandfather. Married to his wife Dorothy for 56 years, a southern belle whom he met while guarding the James River in Virginia during WWII. Max inspired two generations of Goldweber women with his deeply held social values. His daughter Elyse is the founding partner of the law firm of Goldweber Epstein. Ann is a professor and Director of Clinical Education at St. John's Law School. His beloved granddaughter Gabrielle Sloss is pursuing a doctorate in psychology. Max supported many charitable institutions and co-founded Temple Sholom of Westbury over 60 years ago. He was president of the Long Island UJA, B'nai Brith, the Anti-Defamation League and served on the ADL Lawyer's Committee. Max's political activism led to his run for state senate and the presidency of the East Meadow Democratic Club. Max was a prominent litigation attorney for 65 years. A feminist before his time, he established a partnership with a female colleague in the 1950's. He was respected by peers and clients alike. He will be missed by all. Donations in memory of Max Goldweber may be made to Temple Sholom, 675 Brookside Court, Westbury, NY. 1/3
